intro: Strychnos nux-blanda var. hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy nux-blanda, is a shrub native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by orange-red berries. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a rough texture. This variant is distinguished by its dense pubescence, which gives it a distinctive appearance.
